column5: Me and the Mrs. are going Saturday.  We want to check out deals on either the Lund Impact 1875 or Crestliner Raptor 1850  Don't want to start a debate on welded vs rivets but I am interested in peoples opinion on various marinas located in Southwestern ON. I'm located in Kitchener and would prefer to buy from a dealer within a 2 hour radius.  PM's are welcome so as not to advertise or bash any particular dealer.  Thanks, Chris

I think I'm going to skip the boat show but go to the sportsman show for boats and fishing and hunting. Although, if the weather stays as forecasted I'm not fishing this weekend anyway so I might head down after all.
I prefer sportsmans as well, i forget, when is it?
This year it is back at the old Ex grounds and it is February 7-10.
Where and what dates is the boat show, mite go Sunday?

i had good service from tom at huntsville marine.  it may be outside your travel distance but certainly worth considering. he was very accommodating, fair and competitive..  It was worth it for me to travel 6 hours there to go get my 1850 raptor from him!
PM sent! And I will likely go next Saturday. Talk to Doug Heington from Proctor Marine at the Crestliner Booth, and one of the boys from Bay City Marine in the Lund booth. Jim
Not going this year. We sent down a new cedar boat with a Honda on it for the fellows at the Honda display.Also sent down an old Scott Atwater 22hp.
Those would be nice to see.
Sportsman show for me this year, doubt I'll go to the boat show.
I,ll be heading here.   http://springfishingandboatshow.com/wp-content/uploads/2011/11/Outdoor-Canada-Web-Ad.jpg  If I told the mrs,s I was going to the boat show,well,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,
Thanks Bud, I didn't get to go, to busy, and I wanted to look at the Alumicraft boats. Shucks.
